text.title: Celebrate Dad with a Rental Projector
text.head: Celebrate Dad with a Rental Projector
text.p: Does your dad really need another tie? Whether you're celebrating dad for Father's Day, his birthday, or "just because," look at all the great reasons to gift him a weekend rental projector.
text.head: Steps

list.item: Rent a projector. Most rentals are fairly affordable ($130-160 for a full weekend), but if that's outside your price range, consider asking your siblings to chip in. You can rent online and have it delivered most anywhere, or rent from a local rental shop (available if you live in a fairly large city).
Buy your dad an excellent greeting card, or make a "certificate" on your computer. This is a fun and unique way to gift an intangible present, like a weekend projector rental.
Talk to the rest of the family to decide on a weekend that works best for the rental. When is everyone available for at least one afternoon or evening?
Choose a theme (or let Dad decide). Check out the Tips section for ideas.
Rent movies or arrange for pay-per-view if dad wants to watch the big game, or a heavyweight fight. It's easy to connect a rental projector to your television, DVD player, or laptop computer.
Provide the snacks. Remember to choose the snacks dad likes to munch on -- whether that includes fried chicken and chili, or salted nuts, sweets and popcorn.

text.head: Tips

list.item: Part of the fun of this gift involves family participation, so be sure to rent the projector on a weekend when everyone can attend. If you can't arrange this ahead of time, give Dad a gift certificate for a date "TBA" and work with the family to get it scheduled.
You might let Dad decide what he wants to watch during his weekend rental, but here are some suggestions.
Sports weekend. This might involve renting a projector during Super Bowl weekend, the Indy 500, a boxing match, or the Final Four (depending on what's upcoming, and what dad loves best).
Film Fest. Choose dad's favorite films and gather the family to watch these classics together.
Family Movies. Have old home movies transferred to DVD and showcase them in larger-than-life format with a rental projector for dad and the family to enjoy together.
Surprise Night at the Movies. Let each person choose a film dad hasn't seen, but that he's sure to love.

Combo Ticket. Choose from one or more of the above options, or create your own. For example, perhaps your dad loves video games -- in which case you can hook up a rental projector to your favorite gaming system.

text.head: Warnings

list.item: Remember to keep the focus more on dad, as opposed to the wants or desires of you and your siblings.
Don't book the projector rental until you've talked with dad to ensure he's game, and available.
